Adding Logo and Badges to Documentation

✅ Badges Already Added

I’ve added three badges to the top of your documentation (docs/index.rst):

  1. Documentation Status Badge (Read the Docs)

  2. PyPI Version Badge

  3. Python Versions Badge

These will appear at the top of your docs homepage.

🎨 Adding a Logo

Step 1: Prepare Your Logo

Recommended Specifications:

  • Format: PNG with transparent background

  • Size: 200x200 px (or similar square ratio)

  • Max dimensions: 400x400 px

  • File size: < 100 KB

Naming: Save as logo.png

Step 2: Add Logo to Documentation

# Place your logo in the _static directory
cp /path/to/your/logo.png docs/_static/logo.png

# Optional: Add favicon (small icon for browser tab)
cp /path/to/your/favicon.ico docs/_static/favicon.ico

Step 3: Update conf.py

In docs/conf.py, uncomment these lines (already added for you):

# Logo (place logo file in docs/_static/)
html_logo = '_static/logo.png'
html_favicon = '_static/favicon.ico'

# In html_theme_options, uncomment to show logo without text:
html_theme_options = {
    'logo_only': True,  # Show only logo, no "SOLWEIG-GPU" text
    'style_nav_header_background': '#2980B9',  # Custom header color
    ...
}

Step 4: Commit and Push

git add docs/_static/logo.png docs/_static/favicon.ico docs/conf.py
git commit -m "Add logo and favicon to documentation"
git push

🎨 Logo Examples

Example 1: Simple Logo

Place this in docs/_static/logo.png:

┌─────────────────┐
│                 │
│   SOLWEIG-GPU   │
│       🌞        │
│      ⚡💻       │
│                 │
└─────────────────┘

Example 2: Professional Logo

Use a design tool (Canva, Figma, etc.) to create:

  • Icon representing: Sun + GPU + Urban buildings

  • Colors: Blue/green for cooling, orange/red for heat

  • Text: “SOLWEIG-GPU” or just “S-GPU”

Example 3: Use Existing Icon

If you don’t have a logo yet, you can use:

  • University/institution logo

  • Project icon

  • Or just text-based design

📐 Logo Placement Options

Option 1: Logo Only (Clean Look)

html_logo = '_static/logo.png'
html_theme_options = {
    'logo_only': True,  # Hide "SOLWEIG-GPU" text, show only logo
}

Option 2: Logo + Text (Default)

html_logo = '_static/logo.png'
html_theme_options = {
    'logo_only': False,  # Show both logo and "SOLWEIG-GPU" text
}

Option 3: Custom Header Color

html_theme_options = {
    'style_nav_header_background': '#2980B9',  # Blue
    # or '#E74C3C'  # Red
    # or '#27AE60'  # Green
    # or '#8E44AD'  # Purple
}

🚀 Quick Setup (Copy-Paste Ready)

If You Have a Logo File:

# Copy your logo
cp /path/to/logo.png docs/_static/logo.png
cp /path/to/favicon.ico docs/_static/favicon.ico

# Edit docs/conf.py - uncomment these lines:
# html_logo = '_static/logo.png'
# html_favicon = '_static/favicon.ico'

# Commit
git add docs/_static/logo.png docs/_static/favicon.ico docs/conf.py
git commit -m "Add logo and favicon to documentation"
git push

If You Don’t Have a Logo Yet:

The badges are already added! Your documentation will look professional with just the badges. You can add a logo later when you have one.

🎨 Creating a Simple Logo

Option 1: Use Text-Based Logo

Create a simple text logo with online tools:

  • Canva - Free logo maker

  • Hatchful - Shopify’s free tool

  • LogoMakr - Simple online editor

Option 2: Use Python to Generate

# Quick script to create a simple logo
from PIL import Image, ImageDraw, ImageFont

# Create 200x200 image with transparent background
img = Image.new('RGBA', (200, 200), (0, 0, 0, 0))
draw = ImageDraw.Draw(img)

# Draw circle background
draw.ellipse([20, 20, 180, 180], fill=(41, 128, 185, 255))  # Blue

# Add text (you'll need a font file)
# draw.text((100, 100), "S-GPU", fill='white', anchor='mm')

# Save
img.save('docs/_static/logo.png')

Option 3: Use Emoji/Unicode

Simple emoji-based logo:

  • 🌞 (sun) + 💻 (GPU)

  • 🏙️ (urban) + 🌡️ (temperature)

  • Save as image

🔍 Current Badge URLs

Your badges are configured for:

Documentation:

https://readthedocs.org/projects/solweig-gpu/badge/?version=latest

https://img.shields.io/pypi/v/solweig-gpu.svg

These will auto-update when you publish new versions!

✅ What’s Already Done

I’ve added three professional badges to index.rst:

  1. ✅ Documentation Status (Read the Docs)

Logo is optional - just add the image file when you’re ready!

📝 Quick Checklist

  • Add badges to index.rst ✅ (DONE)

  • Configure logo in conf.py ✅ (Ready, just uncomment)

  • Create/obtain logo image (when ready)

  • Place logo in docs/_static/logo.png

  • Uncomment logo lines in conf.py

  • Commit and push

Your documentation already has professional badges - logo is optional! 🎉
